intro: Rosa × dumetorum var. obtusifolia, commonly known as the woolly dog玫瑰, is a hybrid shrub native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and stems covered in soft, white to grayish hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant pink or white flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically oval to elliptical with serrated edges and a leathery texture. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature in temperate climates.
